Reviews: Let me state right off the top that this is a very pleasant movie to watch; a piece of 19th century romantic escapism based on the novel of the same name by Jane Austen that features solid acting on the part of the entire cast and that portrays an entirely convincing picture of pastoral life in the English countryside of the era. Focussing on the Dashwood sisters - Marianne (Kate Winslett) and Elinor (Emma Thompson) - the movie deals with the various potential romances that arise in their lives. The movie is solidly rooted in Victorian stereotypes - it's subdued, the characters are somewhat reserved or possibly even emotionally repressed (except perhaps for Marianne, who generally provides what emotion and colour there is in the movie.) For a movie that deals extensively with romance, love is never too openly expressed. In many respects, this struck me as a perfect vehicle for Hugh Grant, who generally comes across very well playing these subdued, soft-spoken, sort of shy romantic roles, and who therefore seemed perfectly cast as Elinor's love interest Edward. The movie is often mildly humorous as it portrays love's ups and downs, but I wouldn't call any of it downright funny, and there are some powerful scenes (again, featuring Winslet) dealing with Marianne being betrayed by her love interest.I'll confess that this movie isn't really my cup of tea, so to speak. There's nothing wrong with it. It's well-acted, well-written and generally well put together. Personally, and only because it's not really to my taste, I'd give it a 5/10 but if you really like these types of subdued romances or are a fan of Jane Austen (and I understand the movie is fairly faithful to the novel) then you'll rate it much more highly than that.
Resenhas: Permitam-me dizer logo de cara que este 챕 um filme muito agrad찼vel de assistir; uma pe챌a de escapismo rom창ntico do s챕culo XIX, baseada no romance hom척nimo de Jane Austen, que apresenta uma atua챌찾o s처lida por parte de todo o elenco e que retrata uma imagem inteiramente convincente da vida pastoral no campo ingl챗s da 챕poca. Focalizando as irm찾s Dashwood - Marianne (Kate Winslett) e Elinor (Emma Thompson) - o filme trata dos v찼rios romances em potencial que surgem em suas vidas. O filme est찼 solidamente enraizado nos estere처tipos vitorianos - 챕 moderado, os personagens s찾o um tanto reservados ou at챕 reprimidos emocionalmente (exceto talvez Marianne, que geralmente fornece a emo챌찾o e a cor do filme.) Para um filme que lida extensivamente com romance , o amor nunca 챕 expresso abertamente. Em muitos aspectos, isso me pareceu um ve챠culo perfeito para Hugh Grant, que geralmente interpreta muito bem esses pap챕is rom창nticos moderados, de fala mansa e t챠mida, e que, portanto, pareciam perfeitamente representados como o interesse amoroso de Elinor, Edward. O filme geralmente 챕 bem humorado, pois retrata os altos e baixos do amor, mas eu n찾o diria nada disso engra챌ado, e h찼 algumas cenas poderosas (de novo, com Winslet) lidando com Marianne sendo tra챠da por seu interesse amoroso. '' Confesso que este filme n찾o 챕 realmente minha x챠cara de ch찼, por assim dizer. N찾o h찼 nada errado com isso. 횋 bem atuado, bem escrito e geralmente bem organizado. Pessoalmente, e apenas porque n찾o 챕 realmente do meu gosto, eu daria 5/10, mas se voc챗 realmente gosta desses tipos de romances moderados ou 챕 f찾 de Jane Austen (e eu entendo que o filme 챕 bastante fiel ao romance ), voc챗 avaliar찼 muito mais do que isso.

Reviews: I find this adaptation of Jane Austen's novel disappointing. It isn't at all as faithful as the BBC Miniseries Pride and Prejudice. Elinor is only a 19-yr old girl in the novel, so Emily Thompson is far too old to portray her and Hugh Grant makes a really silly Edward (and what silly 20th century jokes are added that weren't in the book at all). Elinor's mother in the book is as romantic and emotional as Marianne whereas the film portrays her as much stricter. I find only Marianne, Sir John and his mother in law well portrayed. Besides, though the Dashwoods were in reduced circumstances, Jane Austen never portrayed them as poor as the film makes them. It's downright silly to have them say they won't buy sugar or beef, whereas the novel shows them entertaining Sir John Dashwood and his family on a regular basis or being so called in their cottage (that doesn't look at all like a cottage) when they invited Edward or Willoughby to stay with them. The only good points are straight from the novel (the witty dialogues), but all that's been added (and subtracted) is of poor quality. Edward and Elinor's romance is not credible, and (but I did not find it credible in the novel either), the male characters don't seem real and the love affairs, except for Marianne and Willoughby's, appear contrived.
Resenhas: Acho esta adapta챌찾o decepcionante do romance de Jane Austen. N찾o 챕 t찾o fiel quanto o Orgulho e Preconceito da Miniss챕rie da BBC. Elinor 챕 apenas uma garota de 19 anos do romance, ent찾o Emily Thompson 챕 velha demais para retrat찼-la e Hugh Grant faz um Edward muito bobo (e que piadas tolas do s챕culo 20 foram adicionadas que n찾o estavam no livro) . A m찾e de Elinor no livro 챕 t찾o rom창ntica e emocional quanto Marianne, enquanto o filme a retrata de maneira mais rigorosa. Encontro apenas Marianne, Sir John e sua sogra bem retratados. Al챕m disso, embora os Dashwoods estivessem em circunst창ncias reduzidas, Jane Austen nunca os retratou t찾o pobre quanto o filme os faz. 횋 absolutamente tolo dizer que eles n찾o compram a챌첬car ou carne, enquanto o romance os mostra entretendo Sir John Dashwood e sua fam챠lia regularmente ou sendo assim chamados em sua casa de campo (que n찾o se parece nada com uma casa de campo ) quando convidaram Edward ou Willoughby para ficar com eles. Os 첬nicos pontos positivos s찾o diretos do romance (os di찼logos espirituosos), mas tudo o que foi adicionado (e subtra챠do) 챕 de baixa qualidade. O romance de Edward e Elinor n찾o 챕 cred챠vel, e (mas tamb챕m n찾o achei cred챠vel no romance), os personagens masculinos n찾o parecem reais e os casos de amor, exceto Marianne e Willoughby, parecem inventados.

Reviews: A solid adaptation of the Jane Austen novel, but still somewhat disappointing. The problem with this film is not (as so often in classic's adaptations) failing to be true to the original, but erring in the other extreme - the film fails to give the story a modern perspective.A problem with Austen's novels from a modern point of view is that it becomes increasingly difficult to care for the heroines and the supposedly hard times they have fallen into.  What made them deserve their original wealth in the first place, what makes the benefactors of their temporary misfortune so undeserving in comparison?  The intended audience of Austen's novels were people belonging to the same social class, people who could naturally identify with the situation the Dashwoods would find themselves in.With a modern audience it is different.  When we see the Miss Dashwoods sitting in a beautiful garden on a sunny day, being read poetry by Colonel Brandon, then the word 'suffering' doesn't readily spring to mind.  We also notice their servants who completely fail to feature in the story - people of their class apparently do not matter.  The film adaptation should have addressed these problems but Emma Thompson preferred to stay close to the original.  As a result, this film makes fine viewing ... for people who own large estates in Somerset.
Resenhas: Uma s처lida adapta챌찾o do romance de Jane Austen, mas ainda um pouco decepcionante. O problema com este filme n찾o 챕 (como tantas vezes nas adapta챌천es cl찼ssicas) falhar em ser fiel ao original, mas errar no outro extremo - o filme n찾o consegue dar 횪 hist처ria uma perspectiva moderna. do ponto de vista 챕 que se torna cada vez mais dif챠cil cuidar das hero챠nas e dos supostos tempos em que eles ca챠ram. O que os fez merecer sua riqueza original em primeiro lugar, o que torna os benfeitores de seu infort첬nio tempor찼rio t찾o merecedores em compara챌찾o? O p첬blico pretendido dos romances de Austen eram pessoas pertencentes 횪 mesma classe social, pessoas que podiam se identificar naturalmente com a situa챌찾o em que os Dashwood se encontrariam. Com um p첬blico moderno, 챕 diferente. Quando vemos a srta. Dashwoods sentada em um belo jardim em um dia ensolarado, sendo lida por poesia pelo coronel Brandon, a palavra 'sofrimento' n찾o vem 횪 mente. Tamb챕m notamos seus empregados que falham completamente em aparecer na hist처ria - pessoas de sua classe aparentemente n찾o importam. A adapta챌찾o do filme deveria ter abordado esses problemas, mas Emma Thompson preferiu ficar perto do original. Como resultado, este filme oferece boa visualiza챌찾o ... para pessoas que possuem grandes propriedades em Somerset.
Description: Rich Mr. Dashwood dies, leaving his second wife and her three daughters poor by the rules of inheritance. The two eldest daughters are the title opposites.

Reviews: I am always interested in how a movie is received on both sides of the Atlantic. This is a film that won the top award at Berlin, but picked up a well deserved academy award for Emma Thompson--not for her acting skills but for her writing skills. Turning Jane Austen into delectable cinema is not an easy chore.The film is unusual. Chinese director Ang Lee ("Crouching tiger, hidden dragon") is not an obvious director that could have brought this literary work on screen--yet he deserves full credit in making the film as a top notch Britisher would have done. Even the executive producer is an American director of no mean repute--Sidney Pollack, who must have known that he was investing in a winner.I applaud Mr Lee for working with cinematographer Michael Coulter to make a film with so many shots that could have made so many picture-postcards. English landscapes have rarely looked so lovely. Details like ladies negotiating horse droppings make the film realistic or the silent appraisal by Willoughby's lady friend of Mariannae Dashwood (Kate Winslet) at the dance are executed with care and intelligence, not common in Chinese cinema. Mr Lee is truly international.Alan Rickman, for once, restrains his histrionics and is a pleasure to watch him interact with well chosen cast.What this film achieves is not merely introduce Jane Austen to new readers, but also argue that literary works can be modified intelligently on screen, without losing authenticity of the original, not just by the English but by people from far away lands. The Berlin Festival jury realized this very well.
Resenhas: Estou sempre interessado em como um filme 챕 recebido nos dois lados do Atl창ntico. Este 챕 um filme que ganhou o pr챗mio principal em Berlim, mas recebeu um merecido pr챗mio da academia por Emma Thompson - n찾o por suas habilidades de atua챌찾o, mas por suas habilidades de escrita. Transformar Jane Austen em um cinema delicioso n찾o 챕 uma tarefa f찼cil. O filme 챕 incomum. O diretor chin챗s Ang Lee ("Tigre agachado, drag찾o oculto") n찾o 챕 um diretor 처bvio que poderia ter trazido esse trabalho liter찼rio para a tela - mas ele merece todo o cr챕dito por fazer o filme como um brit창nico de primeira linha. Mesmo o produtor executivo 챕 um diretor americano de m찼 reputa챌찾o - Sidney Pollack, que deve saber que estava investindo em um vencedor. Aplaudo Lee por trabalhar com o diretor de fotografia Michael Coulter para fazer um filme com tantas cenas que poderiam ter fez tantos cart천es-postais. As paisagens inglesas raramente pareciam t찾o bonitas. Detalhes como mulheres negociando excrementos de cavalos tornam o filme realista ou a avalia챌찾o silenciosa da amiga de Mariannae Dashwood (Kate Winslet), de Willoughby, no baile, s찾o executados com cuidado e intelig챗ncia, que n찾o s찾o comuns no cinema chin챗s. Lee Rick 챕 verdadeiramente internacional. Alan Rickman, por uma vez, restringe seus histri척nicos e 챕 um prazer v챗-lo interagir com um elenco bem escolhido. O que esse filme alcan챌a n찾o 챕 apenas apresentar Jane Austen a novos leitores, mas tamb챕m argumentar que obras liter찼rias podem ser modificado de forma inteligente na tela, sem perder a autenticidade do original, n찾o apenas pelos ingleses, mas por pessoas de terras distantes. O j첬ri do Festival de Berlim percebeu isso muito bem.
Description: Rich Mr. Dashwood dies, leaving his second wife and her three daughters poor by the rules of inheritance. The two eldest daughters are the title opposites.

Reviews: Wow, here's an emotional story that gets you involved and wears you out by the end. I wears you out not from action, but from watching two good ladies suffer heartbreaks one after the other. This is not my normal viewing fare but I am big fan of two things this movie has to offer: (1) Emma Thompson and (2) incredible visuals.Few people were better in the 1990s at playing the sensible-sweet-wholesome and pretty and-always unfairly ignored woman than Thompson (see The Remains Of The Day and Howards End). Your heart aches for this woman whose characters always deserve better than what they receive.. Her facial expressions alone convey pain better than anyone I've ever seen on film. This is perhaps her best work and it was justice she was honored for it. It was refreshing to see Alan Rickman actually place a nice guy and Kate Winslet was appealing, too - a far cry from spoiled brat role in the film that gave her stardom, Titantic.One tip that I found useful in watching this movie. If you are not British, you might switch on the English subtitles to better understand the dialog and the phraseology of early 19th century England, in which this story takes place.The only problem with using the subtitles is that it detracts from marveling at these visuals. This is one of the prettiest films I have ever seen, on both the inside and outside scenes. It's just gorgeous cinematography frame after frame with beautiful colors. Nice music score, too.This kind of story is a bit too soap opera-like for my normal tastes but to watch Thompson and to ogle the colors, sets and scenery makes it all a rewarding experience. For women who like these kind of Jane Austen stories, this must really be a special film. For the rest of us, it's still very much worth seeing, and adding to one's DVD collection. It''s great film-making.

Este 챕 um dos filmes mais bonitos que eu j찼 vi, tanto em cenas internas quanto externas. 횋 apenas um lindo quadro de cinematografia ap처s quadro com cores bonitas. Description: Rich Mr. Dashwood dies, leaving his second wife and her three daughters poor by the rules of inheritance. The two eldest daughters are the title opposites.

Reviews: This is a remarkable film that does a very good job of depicting a rigid and quite hidebound society that often made India's caste system look reasonable and moderate by comparison.  One of the more enjoyable points for me was the fact that the "sense and sensibility" of the title had a most definite 19th Century feel and yet still remains very timeless and does not attempt to force Twentieth Century mores (probably by use of a crowbar) into a script where they do not belong.  Modern day viewpoints do not belong here.  If you want a modern day version, fine.  But it would be, at best, only a glancing and quite loose adaptation of the novel, so why do an adaptation at all, then?  Not all films have to reflect present day sensibilities.  This is a very human and compelling story with a fine cast and wonderfully witty script.  Look for a very dry and understated performance by Hugh Laurie as Mr. Palmer, the long-suffering husband of the daughter of Mrs. Jennings. Were I Mr. Palmer, I'd have long since invested in earplugs or opened a vein.  Very fine film and most highly recommended.

Um dos pontos mais agrad찼veis ?뗢땛ara mim foi o fato de que o "sentido e sensibilidade" do t챠tulo tinha uma sensa챌찾o mais definitiva do s챕culo XIX e ainda permanece muito atemporal e n찾o tenta for챌ar os costumes do s챕culo XX (provavelmente pelo uso de um p챕 de cabra) ) em um script ao qual eles n찾o pertencem. Os pontos de vista modernos n찾o pertencem aqui. Se voc챗 quer uma vers찾o moderna, tudo bem. Mas seria, na melhor das hip처teses, apenas uma adapta챌찾o r찼pida e bastante solta do romance, ent찾o por que, ent찾o, uma adapta챌찾o? Nem todos os filmes precisam refletir as sensibilidades atuais. Esta 챕 uma hist처ria muito humana e convincente, com um elenco excelente e um roteiro maravilhosamente espirituoso. Procure um desempenho muito seco e discreto de Hugh Laurie como Sr. Palmer, o marido sofredor da filha da sra. Jennings. Se eu fosse o Sr. Palmer, h찼 muito que investia em tamp천es para os ouvidos ou abria uma veia. Filme muito fino e altamente recomendado.
Description: Rich Mr. Dashwood dies, leaving his second wife and her three daughters poor by the rules of inheritance. The two eldest daughters are the title opposites.

Reviews: This would appear to be the sort of production the Academy votes as best picture, and indeed Sense and Sensibility was duly nominated in 1996, but lost out to Braveheart. I'm not sure why, but my guess is that Sense and Sensibility lacked something in the minds of the members of the Academy, call it dirt.Everything is a little too pretty, a little too clean and well behaved in this charming adaptation of Jane Austen's first novel. Director Ang Lee might have provided some insight into early 19th century England by showing the poverty and squalor of the London streets instead of just having the girls step around a little horse manure. Lee might also have shown that the servants had it worse than the gentry by expanding the scene where they are let go by showing just where some of them did go. Lee's direction hints at the wider world of poverty and real pain, but rejects having it intrude. Although the full force of the industrial revolution and attendant horrors were yet to come, they might have been presaged so that Austen's world is given perspective for the modern audience. Soon the skies of England would be blackened with smoke from coal and most of its citizens turned into proletarian cogs.But Austen knew and/or cared about that not at all, and instead wrote with singular attention about the gentry and their acquisitive aspirations and genteel manners, and this is the novel that Emma Thompson captured so well in her Academy Award winning screenplay. The fact that the Dashwoods lost their estate and had to live in a cottage and practice thrift within a budget was a very real tragedy to Austen, although not to us. She was obsessed with the injustice of being a young woman without means living within a society that allowed upward mobility by women only through marriage. So she showed women playing that game to perfection, and winning.Emma Thompson as the sensible Elinor Dashwood was flawless, as usual; and Kate Winslet as her sister, the sensual Marianne who wears her heart on her sleeve, proved once again that she is a gifted and charismatic actress second to none. The supporting cast, especially Elizabeth Spriggs as Mrs. Jennings, and Harriet Walter as Fanny Dashwood, was superb. The cinematography was gorgeous, even arresting at times.Most uncomfortable scene: Marianne being bled. This reminds us that sometimes one has to overcome both the disease and the physician.(Note: Over 500 of my movie reviews are now available in my book "Cut to the Chaise Lounge or I Can't Believe I Swallowed the Remote!" Get it at Amazon!)
Resenhas: Esse parece ser o tipo de produ챌찾o que a Academia vota como melhor filme, e de fato Sense and Sensibility foi devidamente indicado em 1996, mas perdeu para o Cora챌찾o Valente. N찾o sei por que, mas meu palpite 챕 que faltava alguma coisa nas mentes dos membros da Academia, chamada de sujeira. Tudo 챕 um pouco bonito demais, limpo demais e bem comportado nessa encantadora adapta챌찾o de O primeiro romance de Jane Austen. O diretor Ang Lee pode ter fornecido algumas id챕ias sobre a Inglaterra do in챠cio do s챕culo 19, mostrando a pobreza e a mis챕ria das ruas de Londres, em vez de apenas fazer as meninas pisarem em um pequeno estrume de cavalo. Lee tamb챕m pode ter demonstrado que os servos a tinham pior do que os gentry, expandindo a cena em que s찾o deixados de lado, mostrando exatamente para onde alguns deles foram. A dire챌찾o de Lee sugere um mundo mais amplo de pobreza e dor real, mas rejeita a intromiss찾o. Embora toda a for챌a da revolu챌찾o industrial e os horrores que estavam por vir ainda estivessem por vir, eles poderiam ter sido pressagiados para que o mundo de Austen tivesse perspectiva para o p첬blico moderno. Logo, os c챕us da Inglaterra seriam enegrecidos com a fuma챌a do carv찾o e a maioria de seus cidad찾os se transformaria em engrenagens prolet찼rias. Mas Austen sabia e / ou n찾o se importava com isso, e escreveu com aten챌찾o singular sobre a nobreza e suas aspira챌천es aquisitivas e gentis. maneiras, e este 챕 o romance que Emma Thompson capturou t찾o bem em seu roteiro vencedor do Oscar. O fato de os Dashwood perderem seus bens e terem que morar em uma cabana e praticar economia dentro de um or챌amento foi uma trag챕dia muito real para Austen, embora n찾o para n처s. Ela estava obcecada com a injusti챌a de ser uma jovem mulher sem meios para viver em uma sociedade que permitia a mobilidade ascendente das mulheres apenas atrav챕s do casamento. Ent찾o, ela mostrou as mulheres jogando esse jogo com perfei챌찾o e vencendo. Emma Thompson como a sensata Elinor Dashwood era impec찼vel, como sempre; e Kate Winslet como irm찾, a sensual Marianne que usa o cora챌찾o na manga, provou mais uma vez que ela 챕 uma atriz talentosa e carism찼tica inigual찼vel. O elenco de apoio, especialmente Elizabeth Spriggs como Sra. Jennings, e Harriet Walter como Fanny Dashwood, foi excelente. A cinematografia era linda, 횪s vezes at챕 prendendo. Cena mais desconfort찼vel: Marianne sendo sangrada. Isso nos lembra que, 횪s vezes, 챕 preciso superar a doen챌a e o m챕dico (nota: mais de 500 das resenhas de meus filmes est찾o agora dispon챠veis no meu livro "Corta para a espregui챌adeira ou n찾o acredito que engoli o controle remoto!" na Amazon!)

Reviews: The unlikely premise of this depressing film is that a pretty hooker falls head-over-heals in love with a perpetual drunk hours after meeting him, inviting him to move in with her. The script is aimless and uninteresting. The characters are poorly drawn; their motivations are never explained. Figgis' direction is self-indulgent and irritating. He has a flashy but empty visual style that would be better suited to a music video than a feature film. One has to strain to hear the dialog over the loud, inane soundtrack. Nobody does crazy/drunk better than Cage, but his character is goofy and one-dimensional. Shue is terrific, although she is too smart and pretty for her character.

O roteiro 챕 sem objetivo e desinteressante. Os personagens s찾o mal desenhados; suas motiva챌천es nunca s찾o explicadas. A dire챌찾o de Figgis 챕 auto-indulgente e irritante. Ele tem um estilo visual chamativo, mas vazio, que seria mais adequado a um videoclipe do que a um longa-metragem. 횋 preciso esfor챌ar-se para ouvir o di찼logo pela trilha sonora alta e sem sentido. Reviews: Yes!   How does one write a comment about a film that has obvious artistic stature, made by a talented director and cast, but is not entertainment? Leaving Las Vegas is not in any way, at least in the given, broadly accepted, lexicon definition of the word, entertainment.  What is it, then?	This is for the "hit your head hard against the wall because it feels so good when you stop" school of film craft.  The concept as represented here is arguably meaningless.  Unrelenting in its presentation of the degradation a man determined to kill himself, it never betrays the sadistic or cruel spirit.   	So what do we have here?  Do we have a re-visitation of the neorealist period?  No, there is essentially no story here, not one that is in the least discernible.  Do we have a study in behavior?  No, we never have a valid clue, only fleeting tokens deliberately nodded at, as to motive.   We never get to know who the characters are beyond a two dimensional display. What we have here, in my humble opinion, is a mistake.  Forget this one. 	We can't close here without saluting the good effort of the lead actors. We can see each actor, however, in far more enjoyable fare.  As for the obviously talented director, Mike Figgis, he presents continuity well but we hope that he learns the meaning of entertainment if he is to make more films.

Sair de Las Vegas n찾o 챕 de forma alguma, pelo menos na defini챌찾o dada amplamente aceita do l챕xico da palavra entretenimento. Ent찾o o que 챕? Isso 챕 para a escola "de bater com a cabe챌a com for챌a na parede, porque 챕 t찾o bom quando voc챗 para" a escola de cinema. O conceito como representado aqui 챕 indiscutivelmente sem sentido. Implac찼vel em sua apresenta챌찾o da degrada챌찾o que um homem decidiu se matar, nunca trai o esp챠rito s찼dico ou cruel. Ent찾o, o que temos aqui? Temos uma nova visita ao per챠odo neorrealista? N찾o, n찾o h찼 essencialmente nenhuma hist처ria aqui, nenhuma que seja menos discern챠vel. Temos um estudo de comportamento? N찾o, nunca temos uma pista v찼lida, apenas fichas fugazes deliberadamente acenavam, como motivo. Nunca sabemos quem s찾o os personagens al챕m de uma exibi챌찾o bidimensional. O que temos aqui, na minha humilde opini찾o, 챕 um erro. Esque챌a este. N찾o podemos fechar aqui sem saudar o bom esfor챌o dos atores principais. Podemos ver cada ator, no entanto, em uma tarifa muito mais agrad찼vel. Quanto ao diretor obviamente talentoso, Mike Figgis, ele apresenta boa continuidade, mas esperamos que ele aprenda o significado do entretenimento para poder fazer mais filmes.

Description: Ben Sanderson, a Hollywood screenwriter who lost everything because of his alcoholism, arrives in Las Vegas to drink himself to death. There, he meets and forms an uneasy friendship and non-interference pact with prostitute Sera.

Reviews: I had heard that this movie was great and depressing.  I mostly just found it to be a disappointment.  Cage as an alcoholic intent on drinking himself to death, and Shue as a prostitute intent on whoring--not that we know *why* or anything.  The best scenes of the movie are when Cage's character fires quips and witticisms in the midst of his drunkenness.  But it's not very depressing, because we just aren't given enough information about the characters to care; Cage is drunk from the start, and never really stops, so it's not like we're witnessing the downfall of some great character.  All we know about him is that his wife and son left him somehow, and that Shue has a deranged pimp and keeps on whorin'.  That's about it.  They proceed to act screwed up and hopeless, as *Sting* sings tepid love songs on the soundtrack (yes, *Sting*).  The soundtrack selections are so silly, they really ruin the mood of certain scenes--when we would naturally be feeling glum or sorry for the characters, there's goofy jazzy crooning and crap going on in the forefront of the sound; music that says, "Oh, those crazy kids!  What wacky things will they do next!"  Does not go well with the visual aspects and storyline at all (unless you consider songs playing that mention "kissing" and "love" as the same stuff happens on the screen to be an amazingly creative example of synchronicity and visual-aural interwinement).  Very poor, and downright harmful to the atmosphere.  By the time the flick ends, you realize: "hey.....nothing much happened in that movie..."  Yes, the acting is pretty damn good from both Cage and Shue, but their characters aren't examined/explored/explained enough for us to get any sort of attachment or lasting interest invested in them, and nothing much happens in terms of plot.  Cage keeps getting drunk, Shue keeps whoring, and every now and then something a-little-more-screwed-up-than-screwed-up happens. That's about it. Maybe the best things about this movie could be summarized and translated into a piece of some other excellent film, but in and of itself, this movie is blatantly lacking.

As melhores cenas do filme s찾o quando o personagem de Cage dispara piadas e brincadeiras no meio de sua embriaguez. Mas n찾o 챕 muito deprimente, porque simplesmente n찾o temos informa챌천es suficientes sobre os personagens para cuidar; Cage est찼 b챗bado desde o in챠cio e nunca para, ent찾o n찾o 챕 como se estiv챕ssemos testemunhando a queda de um grande personagem. Talvez as melhores coisas sobre este filme possam ser resumidas e traduzidas em um peda챌o de outro excelente filme, mas por si s처, esse filme est찼 descaradamente ausente.

Reviews: This movie is one of the most realistic portrayals of the late stages of chemical dependency--complete with dry heaves, bleeding and death! Not exactly a family pic to say the least! It is so unrelentingly depressing and awful I can't recommend it to anyone except that it be shown to addicts (and their families) to show them what to expect. The hero? of the story is a man who deliberately chooses to drink and drug himself to death and that is the only real plot to the movie. Elizabeth Shue plays the clich챕d part of the hooker with a heart of gold (just once I want to see a movie with a hooker who isn't some sort of social worker down deep).By the way, this movie also helped to kill the writer, as O'Brien committed suicide just after selling the movie rights. No wonder it seemed so realistic and awful!

N찾o 챕 exatamente uma foto de fam챠lia para dizer o m챠nimo! 횋 t찾o implac찼vel e deprimente e horr챠vel que n찾o posso recomendar a ningu챕m, exceto que seja mostrado aos adictos (e suas fam챠lias) que lhes mostrem o que esperar. Reviews: It's difficult to understand why this movie created so much hype. Admittedly, Cage's acting was stupendous - but if the movie was trying to send out a message, it failed miserably. It is never revealed what got him to his alcoholic state in the first place; like he says in one scene 'I don't remember if my wife left me coz I drink too much or I drink too much coz my wife left me'. The only solid point which was depressingly evident was how two people, due to their profession (one being a hooker) and personal habit (the other being an alcoholic), are treated as pariahs in the world and find solace in each other, despite not appreciating the choices made by the other. Full marks to Cage and Shue on how they portrayed their respective characters. However, lessons of compromise and compatibility can be put forward in better ways than this.

Nunca 챕 revelado o que o levou ao seu estado alco처lico em primeiro lugar; como ele diz em uma cena: 'N찾o me lembro se minha esposa me deixou porque eu bebo demais ou bebo demais porque minha esposa me deixou'. O 첬nico ponto s처lido que era deprimente evidente era como duas pessoas, devido 횪 sua profiss찾o (uma prostituta) e seu h찼bito pessoal (a outra alco처latra), s찾o tratadas como p찼rias no mundo e encontram consolo uma na outra, apesar de n찾o serem apreciando as escolhas feitas pelo outro. Description: Ben Sanderson, a Hollywood screenwriter who lost everything because of his alcoholism, arrives in Las Vegas to drink himself to death. There, he meets and forms an uneasy friendship and non-interference pact with prostitute Sera.

Reviews: I waited a long time before I saw this award-winning movie. Everything I had read about it led me to believe it was a depressing film. Most films about alcoholics aren't pretty and this was about an alcoholic AND a down-and-out hooker, so how much fun could it be?Maybe because I expected the worst, I found it a pleasant surprise. Sure, the two people weren't exactly "winners" in life but the movie wasn't that depressing, was it? And the film had style and good acting performances from the two leads Nicholas Cage and Elisabeth Shue, right?Yes, but "on further review," as they say in the pro football telecasts, my review has changed 180 degrees. I must have had too many drinks like "Ben" to like this movie in first place. Hey, I am far from any prude but this is nothing but slickly-wrapped soft porn. It's Sleaze with, yes, a capital "S." I can't even describe half the stuff Shue described in this movie, casually discussing almost every sexual act you can think of. Maybe that's cool to critics like Ebert, who thought this was the number one movie of the year. it's just another example of the sick state of mind in the film world, from filmmakers to actors to critics, where "pushing the envelope" is the way to go. It started escalating with "Midnight Cowboy" getting the Academy Award and keeps going, through American Beauty and the sleazy films you saw nominated for this year's Best Picture.Cage won the Academy Award for Best Actor here, and I don't have a problem with that. Shue was equally as good but I found out more than one viewing is like having too many drinks - "not good." It's sad to see soft-porn sordidness because stylish.
Resenhas: Esperei muito tempo antes de ver este filme premiado. Tudo o que eu li sobre isso me levou a acreditar que era um filme deprimente. A maioria dos filmes sobre alco처latras n찾o 챕 bonita e trata-se de uma alco처latra E de uma prostituta decadente, ent찾o, o quanto isso pode ser divertido? Talvez porque eu esperava o pior, achei uma surpresa agrad찼vel. Claro, as duas pessoas n찾o eram exatamente "vencedoras" na vida, mas o filme n찾o era t찾o deprimente, era? E o filme teve estilo e boas atua챌천es dos dois protagonistas Nicholas Cage e Elisabeth Shue, certo? Sim, mas "em uma an찼lise mais aprofundada", como dizem nas transmiss천es de futebol profissional, minha an찼lise mudou 180 graus. Eu devo ter tomado muitas bebidas como "Ben" para gostar deste filme em primeiro lugar. Ei, estou longe de ser puritana, mas isso n찾o passa de pornografia suave e embrulhada. 횋 Sleaze com, sim, um "S" mai첬sculo Eu n찾o posso nem descrever metade das coisas que Shue descreveu neste filme, discutindo casualmente quase todos os atos sexuais que voc챗 pode imaginar. Talvez isso seja legal para cr챠ticos como Ebert, que pensaram que este era o filme n첬mero um do ano. 챕 apenas mais um exemplo do estado de esp챠rito doentio no mundo do cinema, de cineastas a atores e cr챠ticos, onde "empurrar o envelope" 챕 o caminho a percorrer. Come챌ou a escalar com "Midnight Cowboy" recebendo o Oscar e continua, atrav챕s da American Beauty e dos filmes desprez챠veis que voc챗 viu nomeados para Melhor Filme deste ano. com isso. Shue era igualmente bom, mas descobri que mais de uma exibi챌찾o 챕 como tomar muitas bebidas - "n찾o 챕 bom". 횋 triste ver a sordidez da pornografia suave porque elegante.
Description: Ben Sanderson, a Hollywood screenwriter who lost everything because of his alcoholism, arrives in Las Vegas to drink himself to death. There, he meets and forms an uneasy friendship and non-interference pact with prostitute Sera.

Reviews: Ben Sanderson is an alcoholic, who after getting released from his well paid screen writing position, heads to Vegas with his severance pay. Where he seriously plans to drink himself to death. But whilst cruising down the strip he meets Sera, a nicely turned out prostitute, and both troubled souls come together in an unlikely romance. Based around the semi-autobiographical novel by John O'Brien, an alcoholic who committed suicide before the film made it to the screen, this is a sad, dark and deeply upsetting picture. Sanderson and his plight has no motive, we are not fed reasons for his nihilistic behaviour. We find him at the beginning of the film joyously hurtling thru a liquor market isle, promptly filling his shopping cart with bottles of liquor. From here on in we know that this is no ordinary film about an alcoholic trying to get off the booze, we are on a train to Bleakville, stops at Love and Liberation seem a very long way away. Enter Sera, the sweet and wholesome prostitute, who having escaped the abusive and borderline psycho pimp, Yuri, is herself in need of liberation. But can she carry the burden of both as this unlikely and almost certainly doomed romance starts to become significant? Nicholas Cage as Sanderson is terrific, very compelling, realistic and segueing from zany wired comedy to the desolation of Sanderson's death wish descent within a heart beat. Elisabeth Shue as Sera is also incredibly potent, if perhaps guilty of looking too pristine, and prompting questions of why she would be drawn to Ben's world anyway? Shue none the less works her socks off to make Sera sensitive and believable. Directed by Mike Figgis, who shot it beautifully in Super 16 film, the film won a Best Actor Academy Award for Cage, and garnered nominations for Best Actress {Shue} & Best Director and Best Adapted Screenplay {both Figgis}. Massively popular and praised on release, it has lost none of the impact that it had back then. 8/10
Resenhas: Ben Sanderson 챕 um alco처latra que, depois de ser libertado de sua posi챌찾o de roteirista bem paga, dirige-se a Vegas com seu pagamento de indeniza챌찾o. Onde ele planeja seriamente se beber at챕 a morte. Mas enquanto viaja pela Strip, ele conhece Sera, uma prostituta muito bem transformada, e as duas almas problem찼ticas se re첬nem em um romance improv찼vel. Baseado no romance semi-autobiogr찼fico de John O'Brien, um alco처latra que cometeu suic챠dio antes do filme chegar 횪s telas, esta 챕 uma imagem triste, sombria e profundamente perturbadora. Sanderson e sua situa챌찾o n찾o t챗m motivo, n찾o somos alimentados com raz천es para seu comportamento niilista. N처s o encontramos no come챌o do filme correndo alegremente por uma ilha do mercado de bebidas, enchendo prontamente seu carrinho de compras com garrafas de bebida. Daqui em diante, sabemos que este n찾o 챕 um filme comum sobre um alco처latra tentando sair da bebida, estamos em um trem para Bleakville, as paradas em Love and Liberation parecem muito distantes. Entre Sera, a doce e saud찼vel prostituta, que escapou do psicopata abusivo e lim챠trofe, Yuri, precisa ela mesma de liberta챌찾o. Mas ela pode carregar o fardo de ambos, pois esse romance improv찼vel e quase certamente condenado come챌a a se tornar significativo? Nicholas Cage como Sanderson 챕 fant찼stico, muito convincente, realista e segue de com챕dia maluca para a desola챌찾o do desejo de morte de Sanderson em um piscar de olhos. Elisabeth Shue como Sera tamb챕m 챕 incrivelmente potente, se talvez culpada por parecer intocada demais, e suscita perguntas sobre por que ela seria atra챠da pelo mundo de Ben, afinal? Shue, no entanto, tira as meias para tornar Sera sens챠vel e cr챠vel. Dirigido por Mike Figgis, que filmou lindamente no filme Super 16, o filme ganhou um Oscar de Melhor Ator por Cage e recebeu indica챌천es para Melhor Atriz {Shue} & Melhor Diretor e Melhor Roteiro Adaptado {ambos Figgis}. Massivamente popular e elogiado no lan챌amento, n찾o perdeu o impacto que teve na 챕poca. 8/10
Description: Ben Sanderson, a Hollywood screenwriter who lost everything because of his alcoholism, arrives in Las Vegas to drink himself to death. There, he meets and forms an uneasy friendship and non-interference pact with prostitute Sera.

Reviews: If Mike Figgis never made another film, and Nick Cage and Elizabeth Shue retired after making Leaving Las Vegas, they would have done so with impunity. Both actors are superb, and bring the excellent screenplay to life with the help of some masterful dramatic cinematography.Cage plays a suicidal alcoholic who has come to Las Vegas to drink himself to death, and Shue plays the unexpected problem - a prostitute who falls in love with him. The only reason this film did not receive a ten from me is the voice-over technique which was tastefully minimal, but, in my opinion, the only mistake the director made. It does help to provide closure, but I felt that closure was an unnecessary compromise here.This is not an entertaining film, and in truth, I am surprised by its popularity among typical audiences. It is a serious film, and a work of art, but fun is not to be found here. DO NOT see this film if you dislike feeling emotionally drained and ethically challenged, and DO NOT see it if you are very prone to boredom, or easily offended by sexual violence, substance abuse and the horror of daily life on the street. This is an intensely sad film about love shared by people who are caught in the gravity of their lives and can not escape. It is also a story of redemption and respect, found in improbable places. It is NOT a fun-filled frolicking romantic comedy, but rather, the opposite, and it achieves a beauty, dignity and power almost unique among films treating such starkly real and disturbing subjects.

Os dois atores s찾o 처timos e d찾o vida ao excelente roteiro com a ajuda de uma magistral cinematografia dram찼tica. Jake interpreta um alco처latra suicida que veio a Las Vegas para se beber at챕 a morte, e Shue interpreta o problema inesperado - uma prostituta que se apaixona por ele. amor com ele. A 첬nica raz찾o pela qual este filme n찾o recebeu dez de mim 챕 a t챕cnica de dublagem que era de bom gosto m챠nima, mas, na minha opini찾o, o 첬nico erro que o diretor cometeu. Isso ajuda a fornecer o fechamento, mas eu senti que o fechamento era um compromisso desnecess찼rio aqui. N찾o 챕 um filme divertido e, na verdade, estou surpreso com sua popularidade entre o p첬blico t챠pico. 횋 um filme s챕rio e uma obra de arte, mas a divers찾o n찾o pode ser encontrada aqui. N횄O veja este filme se voc챗 n찾o gosta de se sentir emocionalmente esgotado e eticamente desafiado, e N횄O o veja se voc챗 챕 muito propenso ao t챕dio ou facilmente ofendido por viol챗ncia sexual, abuso de subst창ncias e o horror da vida cotidiana nas ruas. Este 챕 um filme intensamente triste sobre o amor compartilhado por pessoas que s찾o pegas na gravidade de suas vidas e n찾o conseguem escapar. 횋 tamb챕m uma hist처ria de reden챌찾o e respeito, encontrada em lugares improv찼veis. N횄O 챕 uma com챕dia rom창ntica divertida e divertida, mas o contr찼rio, e alcan챌a uma beleza, dignidade e poder quase 첬nicos entre os filmes que tratam assuntos t찾o reais e perturbadores.

Reviews: It's not a movie I could bear to watch very often, because it's sad to see people destroy themselves. But Nicolas Cage and Elisabeth Shue are riveting to watch here. As a person who has a past involvement in alcohol and substance abuse, I found Cage's performance especially compelling, and after watching him in this one, I am sure glad that lifestyle is behind me!The chemistry between these two is really great, two people that need each other in different ways, trying to cope with how screwed up their lives have become. Very real performances, if you're faint-of-heart be ready for some strong words, and not just obscenities. Wow! They really lay it on the line. Great performances by two of my favorites.

Como uma pessoa que j찼 teve um envolvimento no abuso de 찼lcool e subst창ncias, achei o desempenho de Cage especialmente atraente e, depois de assisti-lo neste, fico feliz que o estilo de vida esteja atr찼s de mim! A qu챠mica entre os dois 챕 realmente 처tima, duas pessoas que precisam um do outro de maneiras diferentes, tentando lidar com o qu찾o estragadas suas vidas se tornaram. Apresenta챌천es muito reais, se voc챗 est찼 fraco de cora챌찾o, esteja pronto para algumas palavras fortes, e n찾o apenas obscenidades. Uau! Description: In Texas, the naive Travis Rogers quits his job to marry his beloved Stephanie "Stephi" Lawrence and work with his father-in-law. However he decides to buy a car with his US$ 5,000.00 ...                See full summary혻쨩

Reviews: What do you get when you take two parts Prince and the Pauper, one part The Parent Trap and throw in the Olsen Twins? It Takes Two of course!This story starts with the very different lives of two identical strangers (Mary-Kate & Ashley): Alyssa, who is the lonely daughter of a wealthy widower (Steve Guttenberg), and Amanda, an orphan with a "street" attitude who is looked after by her...social worker? caretaker? Diane (Kirstie Alley). For the summer, Amanda and her friends from the orphanage are sent to a camp for disadvantaged children, which just happens to be across the lake from Alyssa's enormous summer home. By chance, the two girls run into each other (literally) in the woods and discover they look exactly the same. After a few minutes of conversation they decide to switch places because...why not?! Now they both must deal with the other's problems--Alyssa struggling with Amanda's adoption to an awful family, and Amanda doing her best to get rid of the gold-digging b!tch Alyssa's father is engaged to. While the girls deal with that, Diane and Alyssa's dad meet and begin a romance. So, will Amanda be able to stop the wedding? Will Alyssa be able to get out of the awful adoptive parents' home? Will anyone believe they are actually someone else? Will Diane and Alyssa's dad get together?This movie is quite bad. As a child I loved it, but that's purely because I loved the Olsen twins/Full House. Everything and everyone in this film is an old clich챕 that was taken from other books and films that did it much better. There is literally nothing new or interesting about the plot line of this film. The acting also leaves something to be desired. Steve Guttenberg, Kirstie Alley, and Philip Bosco as Vicenzo the butler actually did a decent job with what they were handed, but it was still sub-par. More than anything this movie demonstrated something the world seemed to have missed for many years: Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen cannot act for their lives. People forget that they became famous on...not so much acting, but on being cute and essentially being themselves on camera. This is the first role they had where they were not Michelle Tanner or just..."twins" (i.e. themselves)! Neither of them are able to pull off either a high or low class NYC accent and demeanor without sounding like they are pulling it out with a rope. In fact, if I had seen this without knowing who they were, I would think they had never even acted in a school play, nonetheless been "acting" since they were infants. Also, there is something else about this movie that really irritates me. That is, the use of the word "orphan" and Amanda being from an "orphanage". I don't know what films' preoccupation on these anachronistic terms are, but there had not been an orphanage in NYC for over 30 years when this film was made. Not only that, but the term "orphan" has also not been used for a very long time. The fact they are constantly using the word "orphan" in this movie drives me up a wall. All in all this film is pathetic. It's boring, uninteresting, and has some painful acting on the part of the Olsen twins. Some young children may like it, but you're better off getting The Parent Trap if you must sit through it with them.
Resenhas: O que voc챗 ganha quando pega duas partes de Prince e Pauper, uma parte de The Parent Trap e joga os Olsen Twins? 횋 preciso dois, 챕 claro! Esta hist처ria come챌a com as vidas muito diferentes de dois desconhecidos (Mary-Kate e Ashley): Alyssa, que 챕 a filha solit찼ria de um vi첬vo rico (Steve Guttenberg), e Amanda, uma 처rf찾 com um " atitude de rua que 챕 cuidada por ela ... assistente social? zelador? Diane (Beco de Kirstie). Durante o ver찾o, Amanda e suas amigas do orfanato s찾o enviadas para um acampamento para crian챌as desfavorecidas, que fica do outro lado do lago da enorme casa de ver찾o de Alyssa. Por acaso, as duas garotas se encontram (literalmente) na floresta e descobrem que s찾o exatamente iguais. Depois de alguns minutos de conversa, eles decidem trocar de lugar porque ... por que n찾o ?! Agora, os dois precisam lidar com os problemas do outro - Alyssa lutando com a ado챌찾o de Amanda para uma fam챠lia horr챠vel, e Amanda fazendo o poss챠vel para se livrar do pai que Alyssa gosta de cavar ouro. Enquanto as meninas lidam com isso, o pai de Diane e Alyssa conhece e come챌a um romance. Ent찾o, Amanda ser찼 capaz de parar o casamento? Alyssa ser찼 capaz de sair da casa dos terr챠veis pais adotivos? Algu챕m vai acreditar que eles s찾o realmente outra pessoa? O pai de Diane e Alyssa se juntar찼? Este filme 챕 muito ruim. Quando crian챌a, adorei, mas isso 챕 apenas porque amei os g챗meos Olsen / Full House. Tudo e todos neste filme s찾o um velho clich챗 que foi retirado de outros livros e filmes que o fizeram muito melhor. N찾o h찼 literalmente nada de novo ou interessante na trama deste filme. A atua챌찾o tamb챕m deixa algo a desejar. Steve Guttenberg, Kirstie Alley e Philip Bosco como Vicenzo, o mordomo, na verdade, fizeram um trabalho decente com o que lhes foi entregue, mas ainda era insignificante. Mais do que tudo, este filme demonstrou algo que o mundo parecia ter perdido por muitos anos: Mary-Kate e Ashley Olsen n찾o podem atuar por suas vidas. As pessoas esquecem que se tornaram famosas por ... n찾o atuar muito, mas por serem fofas e essencialmente serem elas mesmas na c창mera. Este 챕 o primeiro papel que tiveram quando n찾o eram Michelle Tanner ou apenas ... "g챗meas" (ou seja, elas mesmas)! Nenhum deles 챕 capaz de usar um sotaque ou comportamento de alta ou baixa classe da cidade de Nova York sem parecer que o est찼 puxando com uma corda. De fato, se eu tivesse visto isso sem saber quem eles eram, eu pensaria que eles nunca haviam sequer atuado em uma pe챌a da escola, apesar de estarem "atuando" desde que eram crian챌as. Al챕m disso, h찼 algo mais sobre este filme que realmente me irrita. Ou seja, o uso da palavra "처rf찾o" e Amanda sendo de um "orfanato". Eu n찾o sei qual 챕 a preocupa챌찾o dos filmes com esses termos anacr척nicos, mas n찾o havia um orfanato em Nova York h찼 mais de 30 anos quando este filme foi feito. N찾o apenas isso, mas o termo "처rf찾o" tamb챕m n찾o 챕 usado h찼 muito tempo. O fato de eles estarem constantemente usando a palavra "처rf찾o" neste filme me leva a uma parede. No geral, esse filme 챕 pat챕tico. 횋 chato, desinteressante e tem alguma atua챌찾o dolorosa por parte dos g챗meos Olsen. Algumas crian챌as podem gostar, mas 챕 melhor voc챗 pegar a armadilha dos pais se precisar passar com ela.

Reviews: The movie is about two little girls who try to get a jerk of a fianc챕e gone and get Diane (Kristie Alley) and Roger Callaway (Steve Guttenburg) married. Wait, so Amanda wants to get adopted by Diane, so that makes her Alyssa's stepsister. Yup, something we've seen before, and also predictable.I do not believe that It Takes Two really knows what it wants to be, the story has pacing issues, with the movie most of the time being a light-hearted comedy with some dramatic parts.The idea is based on THE PARENT TRAP, but except the kids in there are sisters.The movie is just a bit too saccharine for me, there could've been more tension going on instead of the dishonest kids turning what could've been a thrilling remake into a sappy romance. And also more development on Roger and Diane's relationship.The movie has some absurd and annoying acting from the Olsen twins, but they seemed to have gave out some great performances for their young ages in their own way. But the best performances go to Kristie Alley, though I think the director could've had been better with her. Now, don't get me wrong, the movie was pretty interesting, I still love the Olsen twins but they could've been in better projects.

N찾o acredito que seja preciso dois realmente sabe o que quer ser, a hist처ria tem problemas de ritmo, com o filme na maioria das vezes sendo uma com챕dia alegre com alguns O filme 챕 apenas um pouco sacarina para mim, poderia ter havido mais tens찾o em vez das crian챌as desonestas transformarem o que poderiam ' Foi um remake emocionante em um romance idiota. E tamb챕m mais desenvolvimento sobre o relacionamento de Roger e Diane. O filme tem uma atua챌찾o absurda e irritante dos g챗meos Olsen, mas eles pareciam ter apresentado 처timas performances para a juventude 횪 sua maneira. Mas as melhores performances v찾o para Kristie Alley, embora eu ache que o diretor poderia ter sido melhor com ela. Agora, n찾o me interpretem mal, o filme foi bem interessante, eu ainda amo os g챗meos Olsen, mas eles poderiam estar em projetos melhores.

Reviews: I watched "It Takes Two" twice and I would watch it another time I guess, but I don't think I would ever tape it. It's just not good enough. But it works perfectly. The movie centers at two cute and smart little girls, who are put in different dresses, different places, different environments and different situations in order to create this common changing-your-identities-humour, this time involving children.We also have a stereotypical villainess, played by Jane Sibbett, exactly this stepmother-in-spe from every child's nightmare. We've seen these characters plenty of times, but who cares, it's the character we want to see here. Another common device is to have one really good actor in a supporting role, why not in the role of a butler? Here we have Philip Bosco, doing all the things expected from the nice butler, doing a fine job. A good thing is that the movie also focuses on the Kirstie Alley character. Kirstie Alley is exactly the right actress to play a cool, slightly crazy and likeable female lead in harmless family entertainment.The point is that the movie uses the same humour, romance and conflict as usual, but skillfully enough, so it doesn't seem like copying. And that the two little girls are so smart that they manage to solve the conflict and get to that happy ending they want. That's what some people want to see and it has often been made much worse. The Olsen twins are alright here, we don't need the best child actresses you can possibly find in a movie like that. Cute, sympathetic and funny as they still are and as the movie just is, my rating is 8 (7,6?) out of 10.
Resenhas: Eu assisti "It Takes Two" duas vezes e eu assisti outra vez, eu acho, mas acho que nunca iria gravar. Simplesmente n찾o 챕 bom o suficiente. Mas funciona perfeitamente. O filme centra-se em duas meninas bonitinhas e inteligentes, que s찾o colocadas em vestidos diferentes, lugares diferentes, ambientes diferentes e situa챌천es diferentes, a fim de criar esse humor comum de mudan챌a de identidade, desta vez envolvendo crian챌as. Tamb챕m temos um estere처tipo. vil찾, interpretada por Jane Sibbett, exatamente essa madrasta em especial do pesadelo de todas as crian챌as. J찼 vimos esses personagens muitas vezes, mas quem se importa, 챕 o personagem que queremos ver aqui. Outro dispositivo comum 챕 ter um ator realmente bom em um papel de apoio, por que n찾o no papel de mordomo? Aqui temos Philip Bosco, fazendo todas as coisas esperadas do bom mordomo, fazendo um bom trabalho. Uma coisa boa 챕 que o filme tamb챕m se concentra no personagem Kirstie Alley. Kirstie Alley 챕 exatamente a atriz certa para interpretar uma protagonista feminina legal, um pouco louca e simp찼tica em entretenimento inofensivo para a fam챠lia. como copiar. E que as duas meninas s찾o t찾o inteligentes que conseguem resolver o conflito e chegar ao final feliz que desejam. 횋 o que algumas pessoas querem ver e, muitas vezes, fica muito pior. As g챗meas Olsen est찾o bem aqui, n찾o precisamos das melhores atrizes infantis que voc챗 pode encontrar em um filme como esse. Bonito, simp찼tico e engra챌ado como ainda s찾o e, como o filme 챕, minha classifica챌찾o 챕 de 8 (7,6?) Em 10.

Reviews: This was "cute" for a while and then became too teener-bopper oriented for me. I guess if you are a 13-16-year-old female, you'd relate and like this film.Sad to say, it's another film which gives poor messages to teens. Hey, kids....want to have casual sex? No problem....go for it! Nice. Leave it the ultra--Liberal and moral bankrupt world of film making. Clueless is a good title for people who make films like this, not just the lead character in the movie.According to Hollywood, being a teen - as shown in this movie -- revolves only around your social life, plastic surgery, cellphones, drugs and sex. It's all made nice and surgery by having the pretty and sweet-looking Alice Silverstone in the lead. She plays the not-so-- sweet "Cher," an apt name for materialistic, spoiled brat. When the messages are, for example, virginity is bad, but drugs are okay, even fun to experiment.This tale of teen matchmaking and other topics that will make an adult want to puke, does have a decent cast with always-interesting guys like Dan Hedeya and Wallace Shawn and another young "hottie" in Brittany Murphy. However, you wouldn't want your kids to watch this garbage, believe me.Overall, the title says is all.

Ei, crian챌as ... quer fazer sexo casual? N찾o tem problema .... v찼 em frente! Agrad찼vel. Deixe o mundo ultra-liberal e moral da bancarrota do cinema. Clueless 챕 um bom t챠tulo para pessoas que fazem filmes como esse, n찾o apenas o personagem principal do filme.De acordo com Hollywood, ser adolescente - como mostrado neste filme - gira apenas em torno de sua vida social, cirurgia pl찼stica, celulares, drogas e sexo. Tudo ficou legal e cir첬rgico, com a bonita e doce Alice Silverstone na lideran챌a. Ela interpreta o n찾o t찾o doce "Cher", um nome adequado para moleque materialista e mimado. Reviews: I recently taped and watched "Clueless" when it was on the USA channel. The TV Now gave it 3 out of 4 stars. Friends and classmates have been raving about it since third grade. The general plot of a spoiled, popular valley girl making over a "loser" sounded like it had potential. I was excited and looking forward to some high-quality comedy, along the lines of "Austin Powers" or "Superstar". I could not have been more disappointed if I had watched a Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen movie. At least the twins act their age. Let me just say this: If "Clueless" had been a 5-minute skit on "Saturday Night Live", it might have made it. Fashion dilemmas and that '90s valley girl dialect get old after ten minutes, let alone after over an hour. And the ending! Blech! It doesn't get much sappier than that! Unless you adore teen movies, I'd, like, totally avoid "Clueless".

Fiquei empolgado e ansioso por uma com챕dia de alta qualidade, como "Austin Powers" ou "Superstar". Eu n찾o teria ficado mais decepcionado se tivesse assistido a um filme de Mary-Kate e Ashley Olsen. Reviews: Silky-smooth, vanilla-coated pleasure about matchmaking in modern-day high school. Far from the insufferable smugness of all those '80s teen-flicks, "Clueless" is bright--in both senses of the word--clever, funny, fanciful and yet grounded in reality (a rich one). Alicia Silverstone is adorable, but the supporting cast is affable and seemingly carefully-picked (they all get their share of funny lines, particularly Dan Hedaya superb as Silverstone's father). Seems more inspired by Jane Austen's "Emma" than based upon it, with a few mean-spirited lines but plenty of lightly innocent laugh-getters. **1/2 from ****

Longe da presun챌찾o insuport찼vel de todos os filmes de adolescentes dos anos 80, "Clueless" 챕 brilhante - nos dois sentidos da palavra - inteligente, engra챌ado, fantasioso e, no entanto, fundamentado na realidade (rico). Alicia Silverstone 챕 ador찼vel, mas o elenco de apoio 챕 af찼vel e aparentemente cuidadosamente escolhido (todos eles t챗m sua parte de falas engra챌adas, particularmente Dan Hedaya, soberbo como o pai de Silverstone). Parece mais inspirado em "Emma", de Jane Austen, do que baseado nele, com algumas falas mesquinhas, mas muitas risadas levemente inocentes. ** 1/2 de ****

Reviews: I wasn't expecting much of this movie, until I started seeing it. It turned out to be quite entertaining. "Clueless" is about the shallow and rather stupid rich girl Cher Horowitz, who only cares about herself and how popular she is. But then she starts this kind of 'project', together with her best friend. One of the aspects of this project is about making a new silly girl of their school look as 'cool' as they are. This 'silly' girl is very well performed by Brittany Murphy. I hardly recognized her! The lead role is for Alicia Silverstone who gives an excellent performance as well. Furthermore there is another great performance Paul Rudd (who we also know as Phoebe's boyfriend in "Friends"). Also Dan Hedaya and Breckin Meyer (Road Trip) are funny.Funny and very entertaining movie from the director of "Look Who's Talking (Too). Definitely worth watching! 7,5/10

Mas ent찾o ela come챌a esse tipo de 'projeto', junto com sua melhor amiga. Um dos aspectos desse projeto 챕 fazer com que uma nova garota boba da escola pare챌a t찾o "legal" quanto elas. Essa garota 'boba' 챕 muito bem interpretada por Brittany Murphy. Eu mal a reconheci! O papel principal 챕 de Alicia Silverstone, que tamb챕m apresenta um excelente desempenho. Reviews: Cher (Alicia Silverstone) is a popular ditz at her local high school in Beverly Hills. She's a spoiled, pampered little princess with all the right social connections and endless wealth. However she has yet to find a man in her life - all the Baldwins (as she and her clique of friends call guys they like) have been taken.When Cher receives a foreign exchange student, she takes her under her wing and decides to try and find her a boyfriend - ironically without having her own yet. Predictability ensues.I read "Emma" in early high school as I'm sure most kids did, and the movie puts a clever spin on the tale. Alicia Silverstone is surprisingly good in her role, perfectly playing a blond bombshell without a brain but a good heart - only Reese Witherspoon has done such a good job recently at portraying the west coast bimbos. (No offense to the west coast bimbos out there.) The movie's director, Amy Heckerling, has always been rather reliable on the whole and her direction is solid here - she could have turned "Clueless" into a crude, unfunny sex comedy with little wit or brains, but instead she takes a rather dubious idea for a film and transforms it into a well-made, well-acted, funny, inspired, lively, witty satire.Much better than expected.

No entanto, ela ainda n찾o encontrou um homem em sua vida - todos os Baldwins (como ela e sua camarilha chamam de caras que eles gostam) foram levados. Quando Cher recebe um estudante de interc창mbio, ela a coloca sob suas asas e decide tentar e encontrar um namorado para ela - ironicamente, ainda sem ter o seu. Previsibilidade se segue. Eu li "Emma" no in챠cio do ensino m챕dio, como tenho certeza que a maioria das crian챌as fez, e o filme d찼 uma guinada inteligente na hist처ria. Muito melhor do que o esperado.

Reviews: "Let's set 'Emma' in a modern high school!"  Does this sound the obvious kind of movie gimmick that everyone uses nowadays?  Perhaps, but it's an inspired idea all the same.  Jane Austen's characters, and her readers, and the society in which her novels are set, like Jane Austen herself, are HEAVILY conscious of class and social standing.  No atmosphere quite so snobbish exists in the modern world.  EXCEPT, that is, in the corridors and courtyards of the right kind of high school.  And where else in the modern world would you find so many people who seem to spend all their time calling on one another?I was reminded of how well Heckerling moulded "Emma" to fit a modern setting when I saw the idiotic 1998 version of "Great Expectations", adapted by someone who somehow failed to notice how important all the stuff about class and snobbishness was.  It's clear that Heckerling understood her source. She isn't afraid to make changes - even radical changes, if the modern setting requires as much - and no character exists MERELY because they have an analogue in Austen's novel.  (The most crucial thing is that the Emma-equivalent be sufficiently charming; and so she is.)  The result is a film which is winning and satisfying, whether or not you know anything about the source material.
Resenhas: "Vamos colocar 'Emma' em uma escola moderna!" Parece o tipo 처bvio de truque de filme que todo mundo usa hoje em dia? Talvez, mas 챕 uma ideia inspirada da mesma forma. Os personagens de Jane Austen, seus leitores e a sociedade em que seus romances se desenrolam, como Jane Austen, s찾o PESAMENTE conscientes de classe e posi챌찾o social. Nenhuma atmosfera t찾o esnobe existe no mundo moderno. EXCETO, isto 챕, nos corredores e p찼tios do tipo certo de ensino m챕dio. E onde mais no mundo moderno voc챗 encontraria tantas pessoas que parecem passar o tempo todo se chamando? Eu me lembrei de como Heckerling moldou "Emma" para se encaixar em um ambiente moderno quando vi a idiota vers찾o de 1998 de " Great Expectations ", adaptado por algu챕m que de alguma forma n찾o percebeu o qu찾o importante era tudo sobre classe e esnobismo. 횋 claro que Heckerling entendeu sua fonte. Ela n찾o tem medo de fazer mudan챌as - mesmo mudan챌as radicais, se o cen찼rio moderno exigir tanto - e nenhum personagem existe MERELY porque eles t챗m um an찼logo no romance de Austen. (O mais crucial 챕 que o equivalente 횪 Emma seja suficientemente charmoso; e ela tamb챕m 챕.) O resultado 챕 um filme que 챕 vitorioso e satisfat처rio, sabendo ou n찾o alguma coisa sobre o material de origem.
Description: Shallow, rich and socially successful Cher is at the top of her Beverly Hills high school's pecking scale. Seeing herself as a matchmaker, Cher first coaxes two teachers into dating each other.

Reviews: Director Amy Heckerling knows a thing or two about high school flicks, having directed the highly successful `Fast Times at Ridgemont High'. Heckerling put her talents to work thirteen years later for the next generation of high schoolers, writing and directing this hilarious satire of life at Beverly Hills H.S.  Heckerling takes a different approach from `Fast Times', which found its comedy in the absurdity of reality, depicting situations into which teenagers really get themselves.  Here Heckerling's comedy mostly comes from mocking the superficiality of the high school `in-crowd'.  While this is not the first time this has been done, few have ever done it with such blistering wit.  This film became the standard for a spate of 1990's high school flicks set on the west coast that borrowed many of its elements.The story focuses on Cher Horowitz (Alicia Silverstone), who is the most popular girl at Beverly Hills H.S.  Cher seems to be a superficial airhead, but this belies her conniving and manipulative skills at getting what she wants.   Superficial yes, airhead no!  In a plot derived in part from Jane Austen's `Emma', Cher works behind the scenes to arrange love matches between various students.  She even orchestrates a relationship between two teachers to improve their moods so they don't grade so harshly.  Like Emma, she is a master of love for everyone but herself.Heckerling does a fantastic job of presenting what seems on the surface to be a cotton candy story with lightweight characters, but really runs much deeper revealing subtle truths about human nature.  Her direction of the fledgling cast is superb, milking every ounce of comedy out of each scene.Silverstone sparkles in the role, which is probably not far from a reality with which she is very familiar.  She actually attended Beverly Hills H.S. with co-star Breckin Meyer, although she didn't graduate due to career commitments (she received a G.E.D.).  This film catapulted her to teen prominence with two MTV movie awards and an American Comedy Award as funniest actress in a leading role.  She plays Cher with both arrogance and vulnerability, and her comic timing is impeccable.  She also has a knack for physical comedy, with a broad range of contorted facial expressions and amusing use of body language.  The rest of the teen cast is also great, especially Brittany Murphy as Tai and Breckin Meyer as Travis.  Dan Hedaya is also priceless as Cher's work obsessed attorney father.This film is easy to like.  It is a light and funny spoof, but it still has nuance.  I rated it an 8/10.  For those who enjoy high school comedies, this is required viewing.
Resenhas: A diretora Amy Heckerling sabe uma coisa ou duas sobre filmes do ensino m챕dio, tendo dirigido o altamente bem sucedido `Fast Times at Ridgemont High '. Heckerling colocou seus talentos para trabalhar treze anos depois para a pr처xima gera챌찾o de estudantes do ensino m챕dio, escrevendo e dirigindo essa hilariante s찼tira da vida em Beverly Hills H.S. Heckerling adota uma abordagem diferente de Fast Times, que encontrou sua com챕dia no absurdo da realidade, descrevendo situa챌천es nas quais os adolescentes realmente se envolvem. Aqui, a com챕dia de Heckerling vem principalmente de zombar da superficialidade da escola no meio da multid찾o. Embora essa n찾o seja a primeira vez que isso 챕 feito, poucos o fizeram com tanta intelig챗ncia. Este filme se tornou o padr찾o para uma s챕rie de filmes da d챕cada de 90 na costa oeste que pegaram emprestados muitos de seus elementos. A hist처ria se concentra em Cher Horowitz (Alicia Silverstone), que 챕 a garota mais popular de Beverly Hills H.S. Cher parece ser uma cabe챌a de pouso superficial, mas isso esconde suas habilidades coniventes e manipuladoras para conseguir o que quer. Superficial sim, airhead n찾o! Em um enredo derivado em parte de Emma, ?뗢땊e Jane Austen, Cher trabalha nos bastidores para organizar encontros de amor entre v찼rios alunos. Ela ainda organiza um relacionamento entre dois professores para melhorar seu humor, para que eles n찾o sejam t찾o severos. Como Emma, ?뗢땎la 챕 uma mestre em amar a todos, menos a si mesma. Heckerling faz um trabalho fant찼stico em apresentar o que parece ser uma hist처ria de algod찾o doce com personagens leves, mas realmente 챕 muito mais profundo, revelando verdades sutis sobre a natureza humana. Sua dire챌찾o para o elenco incipiente 챕 excelente, ordenando cada grama de com챕dia de cada cena. Ela realmente participou de Beverly Hills H.S. com a co-estrela Breckin Meyer, embora ela n찾o tenha se formado devido a compromissos de carreira (ela recebeu um G.E.D.). Este filme a catapultou para destaque adolescente com dois pr챗mios MTV e um American Comedy Award como atriz mais engra챌ada em um papel de lideran챌a. Ela interpreta Cher com arrog창ncia e vulnerabilidade, e seu timing c척mico 챕 impec찼vel. Ela tamb챕m tem um talento especial para a com챕dia f챠sica, com uma ampla gama de express천es faciais distorcidas e uso divertido da linguagem corporal. O resto do elenco adolescente tamb챕m 챕 처timo, especialmente Brittany Murphy como Tai e Breckin Meyer como Travis. Dan Hedaya tamb챕m 챕 inestim찼vel como o pai do advogado obcecado pelo trabalho de Cher. Este filme 챕 f찼cil de gostar. 횋 uma par처dia leve e engra챌ada, mas ainda tem nuances. Eu avaliei um 8/10. Para quem gosta de com챕dias do ensino m챕dio, isso 챕 necess찼rio.

Reviews: This movie is way above so many of the others of its' kind. It's consumately likable, funny, sweet and sharp- the script is a killer, and the acting is fun and enjoyable.Part of the success of the film is due to the fact that it appeals to several different audiences, and on multiple levels. I first watched this movie with my mom, who loved the link it has to Jane Austen's Emma- all the main characters and the plot are direct modern equivalents to the novel. For instance, the famous passage in Emma inwhich Harriet burns all her "mementos" of Mr. Elton becomes the scene where Tai does so infront of Cher's gasfire. From this perspective alone, the movie is so fun and sharp to watch- even if your forte isn't usually American Teen High School comedy!But this movie works on a really dumbed down scale too- let's face it, not everyone is big on English literature. The movie has an awesome soundtrack, Paul Rudd is unbelievably cute as "Mr Knightly" or rather Josh- and my boyfriend leads me to believe that the same is true of Alicia Silverstone- who still sparkles 10 years later as a mid-nineties teen queen with good intentions, Cher. Her performance here is impossible not to warm too, unless you have some sort of grudge against Valley girls, inwhich case you might not like it so much. Seriously though, this film is a must see for anyone who likes some real quality comedy- I'm so fond of this film personally that I would suspect basically everyone would enjoy it.
Resenhas: Este filme est찼 muito acima de muitos outros do g챗nero. 횋 consumadamente simp찼tico, engra챌ado, doce e afiado - o roteiro 챕 um assassino, e a atua챌찾o 챕 divertida e agrad찼vel. Parte do sucesso do filme se deve ao fato de atrair v찼rios p첬blicos diferentes e em v찼rios n챠veis. Eu assisti esse filme pela primeira vez com minha m찾e, que adorou o v챠nculo que ela tem com a Emma de Jane Austen - todos os personagens principais e o enredo s찾o equivalentes modernos diretos ao romance. Por exemplo, a famosa passagem em Emma, ?뗢땙a qual Harriet queima todas as suas "lembran챌as" do Sr. Elton, torna-se a cena em que Tai o faz na frente do fogo de Cher. A partir dessa perspectiva, o filme 챕 t찾o divertido e n챠tido de assistir - mesmo que o seu forte n찾o seja geralmente a com챕dia da American Teen High School! Mas esse filme funciona em uma escala realmente muito est첬pida - vamos enfrent찼-lo, nem todos s찾o grandes Literatura inglesa. O filme tem uma trilha sonora incr챠vel, Paul Rudd 챕 incrivelmente fofo como "Mr Knightly" ou melhor, Josh - e meu namorado me leva a acreditar que o mesmo se aplica a Alicia Silverstone - que ainda brilha 10 anos depois como rainha adolescente de meados dos anos 90 com boas inten챌천es, Cher. O desempenho dela aqui 챕 imposs챠vel de n찾o aquecer tamb챕m, a menos que voc챗 tenha algum tipo de ressentimento contra as garotas do Valley, caso em que voc챗 talvez n찾o goste tanto. S챕rio, por챕m, este filme 챕 imperd챠vel para quem gosta de com챕dia de qualidade real - gosto tanto desse filme pessoalmente que suspeitaria que basicamente todos gostariam.

Reviews: "Isn't my house classic? The columns date all the way back to 1972."When romantic high-school comedy Clueless (1995) was released, it was immediately vaulted into cult-status and firmly stapled as one of the most original teen-flicks of the 1990s. 'Original' is perhaps a term wrongly applied since it is based on the queen of romance Jane Austen's Emma (1815) . But what Clueless did was update the classic story by coating it with high school drama, teenage girls and shopping and sprinkle it with heavy doses of humour.Emma is no longer Emma; she is Cher (Alicia Silverstone), a spoiled rich girl walking around in her Beverly Hills mansion in a bubble of stereotypes and teen-clich챕s -- but with a great big heart. So big-hearted, in fact, that she takes on the lost goofy new girl in her school to find her love and popularity, knowing full-well that it could destroy her own reputation. Clueless thus sees Cher and her best friend Dionne (Stacey Dash) on a mission to do good. Real good.All the detours this mission entail are captured brilliantly in the film, taking the form of love-interests, parties, shopping and misunderstandings. From Cher's grumpy lawyer-father (an hilarious Dan Hedaya) and her nerdy step-brother (a likable Paul Rudd) to her eccentric group of friends at school, Clueless is a superb ride of teenage comedy camp. Only just over 10 years old, it is still extremely dated today. But no matter, because the 90s clich챕s like skateboarding, Marky Mark and the catch-phrase "As if" just make it so much more contemporary and fun to watch. What elevates Clueless (1995) above generic high school comedy is its use of stereotypes. In most films they are unintentionally there to create a subconscious effect, but in Clueless they are made fun of to a much higher degree -- they are overblown and glorious. It brutally satirizes rich kids and their 'problems' and juxtaposes them with a classic, heart-felt love-story. The kind that only Jane Austen can write.9/10
Resenhas: "A minha casa n찾o 챕 cl찼ssica? As colunas datam de 1972." Quando a com챕dia rom창ntica do ensino m챕dio Clueless (1995) foi lan챌ada, ela foi imediatamente convertida em status de culto e firmemente grampeada como uma das adolescentes mais originais. - filmes dos anos 90. "Original" 챕 talvez um termo incorretamente aplicado, pois se baseia na rainha do romance Emma, ?뗢땊e Jane Austen (1815). Mas o que Clueless fez foi atualizar a hist처ria cl찼ssica, revestindo-a de drama do ensino m챕dio, adolescentes e compras e polvilhe-a com grandes doses de humor. Emma n찾o 챕 mais Emma; ela 챕 Cher (Alicia Silverstone), uma garota rica e mimada andando em sua mans찾o em Beverly Hills em uma bolha de estere처tipos e clich챗s adolescentes - mas com um grande cora챌찾o. T찾o de cora챌찾o grande, de fato, que ela assume a nova pateta perdida em sua escola para encontrar seu amor e popularidade, sabendo muito bem que isso poderia destruir sua pr처pria reputa챌찾o. Na maioria dos filmes, eles involuntariamente est찾o l찼 para criar um efeito subconsciente, mas em Clueless eles s찾o ridicularizados em um grau muito mais alto - eles s찾o exagerados e gloriosos. Satiriza brutalmente crian챌as ricas e seus 'problemas' e as justap천e com uma hist처ria de amor cl찼ssica e sentida pelo cora챌찾o. O tipo que apenas Jane Austen pode escrever.

Reviews: I found the movie not very engaging and hard to get into. Things happened but it just felt like they did to move the plot forward. The acting in this movie was dry and it felt like a b-flick movie. The story was what it was and whatever it was about by the time it was over I didn't care much for it. The women in this movie are pretty and I guess that's a plus... just not enough of a plus to actually watch this movie from start to finish. I felt like it could of been done better but the way it was executed felt very low budget and just straight forward that didn't give you much of a reason to guess about anything or try to solve the mystery.
